projects.title: Stats for Spotify
projects.subtitle: SIDE PROJECT
projects.description: Take control of your own Spotify statistics
projects.text:
This was a side project I created during the final year of my bachelor degree. I wanted to track my own Spotify statistics, but quickly realised the most detailed data was paid content in otherwise free apps. Since I was (and still am) a student, I figured I could create this myself.

I had also been using React Native a lot for my final project of my degree. This meant I had an idea of how to create my own app. I therefore decided to get to work!

projects.title: Election 2023
projects.subtitle: INTERNSHIP 2023
projects.description: All the info you need about the Norwegian election 2023
projects.techStack: Svelte (NRK Template), Node.js, Polopoly, F#, TypeScript
projects.text: In the summer of 2023, I worked at NRK, where I, along with 4 other summer interns, was tasked with creating a website as part of their election campaign for the 2023 municipal and county elections. This website served as a central hub for all election-related content produced by NRK across their various platforms, including radio, television, and NRK.no. The project aimed to target second-time voters aged 20-25 with the goal of engaging this demographic and encouraging them to vote.

projects.title: Properate
projects.subtitle: BACHELOR THESIS
projects.description: Fast and easy access to all data related to technical services
projects.techStack: React Native (Expo), Cognite Data Fusion, Python, JavaScript, Crontab
projects.text:
This project was a part of my final project from my bachelors degree in computer science & engineering. Our group was tasked with optimizing data flow by improving the extraction and provisioning of data, from an older customer management system, used to store data about energy consumption and documents of buildings. As a result, an app combining data from an older database with data from a newer system was born. This app could improve the internal workflow of the customer, by providing useful information, fetched from multiple places, that naturally belonged together.

This project will be further developed as a part time job, and has a goal of being published by the end of 2023.
